intro: Jacobinia suberecta, commonly known as the erect Jacobinia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Jacobinia suberecta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
